errors.error_description: The introductory sentence incorrectly states the tool is a 'Python 3.6 only library', when it actually requires Python 3.7 or later.
The shell completion command has the `source` keyword incorrectly placed inside the process substitution `<()`, which is a syntax error and will fail.
correction_candidates: Move the `source` command outside the process substitution, to be `$ source <(_YKMAN_COMPLETE=bash_source ykman | sudo tee /etc/bash_completion.d/ykman)`.
Replace the entire line with `eval "$(_YKMAN_COMPLETE=bash_source ykman)"` and pipe it to tee.
errors.golden_answer: Move the `source` command outside the process substitution, to be `$ source <(_YKMAN_COMPLETE=bash_source ykman | sudo tee /etc/bash_completion.d/ykman)`.
